text:
Eighth Ave. (white bridgelike structure in center) from West 31st (right of No. 2) to 33rd (left of No. 1) Streets, showing in the foreground the site where the general Post Office stands today (1938). Across the Avenue one sees the steel structural framework for the Pennsylvania Railroad Station. These two photos form a panoramic view eastward from a vantage point near Ninth Ave. and shows a different skyline from what one sees today. Note Macys at the left and the Metropolitan Tower (under construction) at the right.
May 1908.
George L. Balgue.

These two photos form a panoramic view eastward from a vantage point near Ninth Ave. and shows a different skyline from what one sees today. 254-263 West 31st Street, at and adjoining the N.E.
Eighth Avenue.
About 1924.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

Eighth Avenue (immediate foreground, street level not
seen) and environs, from W. 31st (intersection at left), to
33rd (right) Streets, as viewed westward from the Equitable
Life Insurance Co. Building on Seventh Avenue, and showing the
thoroughfare and the railroad yards behind same. View 2
of the Pennsylvania Station. The 22 story structure seen is
the Printing Crafts Building and is between 33rd and 34th Streets.
Note in the background the North (Hudson) River and the Jersey
shoreline.

April 2, 1928
Views 1 and 2

P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

NO REPRODUCTIONS.

(1)
31st Street, north side, from west of Eighth to but not including Seventh Avenues, showing the roofs of the buildings on the south side of the street. The view shows part of the main branch of the Post Office and across the street is the
Pennsylvania Railroad Station.
January 25, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
(2)
The 31st Street entrance to the Pennsylvania Station.
May 3, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

A rear view of the main branch of the United States Post Office, Eighth Avenue, west side, from 31st to 32nd Streets, as seen from
the Pennsylvania Railroad yards.
January 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

Eighth Ave., north from but not including West 31st Street, showing the General Post Office extending to West 33rd Street. On the right appears (in part) the Pennsvlvania Railroad Station. Also shown (center) is the 22-story Printing Crafts Building, at the N.W. corner of West
33rd, Street.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

Here Comes The Bonus !
New York Postmen trooping down the steps of General Post Office to make the first deliveries of bonus certificates in New York. Some 275,000 Veterans in New York will receive the bonus.
Credit Line (AQE) 8-15-36

252-236 West 31st Street, south side, east of Eighth
Avenue.
March 18, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

31st Street, 8th Avenue to 9th Avenue.(Before Reconstructiion)
President Borough of Manhatten.
